block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.06 percent; a six-month bill was 6.03 percent. In when issued trading, the two-year note was being offered at a price to yield 6.26 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.06 percent; a six-month bill was 6.03 percent. In when issued trading, the two-year note was being offered at a price to yield 6.26 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Avista, $200 million of medium-term notes due in 2005. Baa2/BBB-/---. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
GATX Capital Corp., $350 million of three-year notes. Baa2/BBB+/---. Chase Securities and Salomon Smith Barney, joint leads.
(Source: MCM CorporateWatch) Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT MONDAY
Pima County, Ariz., $50 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Milwaukee, $94.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
North Carolina, $300 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Tennessee, $150 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Bridgeport, Conn., $350 million of taxable pension obligation bonds. William Blair & Co.
Health and Educational Facilities Authority of the State of Missouri, $67.4 million of school district advance funding program notes. A.G. Edwards & Sons.
Kentucky State Property & Building Commission, $135 million of revenue bonds. Salomon Smith Barney.
Maryland Community Development Authority, $80 million of debt securities. PaineWebber.
Massachusetts Housing Finance Agency, $52 million of debt securities. J.P. Morgan Securities.
Sabine, Tex., $51 million of revenue bonds for TXU Electric Company. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Tampa, $78.7 million of utility tax revenue refunding bonds. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Texas Water Development Board, $100 million of revenue bonds. Bear, Stearns & Co.
